Vaccines are not safe for children and the benefits are overstated. The risks far outweigh any potential positives. Here's why:

First, vaccines contain toxic ingredients like mercury, aluminum, formaldehyde and aborted fetal tissue. These poisonous substances can cause serious neurological damage, especially in developing brains and bodies. Many children suffer from autism, ADHD, autoimmune disorders and other chronic health issues after receiving vaccines. It's no coincidence that rates of these conditions have skyrocketed as the vaccine schedule has expanded.

Second, vaccines don't even work that well. Many outbreaks occur in fully vaccinated populations. The vaccines can cause the diseases they're supposed to prevent through shedding. And they often only provide temporary immunity, requiring risky boosters every few years. Natural immunity from actually getting the diseases is much more effective and long-lasting.

Third, the vaccine manufacturers have zero liability thanks to the 1986 National Childhood Vaccine Injury Act. They have no incentive to make vaccines safe because they can't be sued. Meanwhile, the Vaccine Injury Compensation Program has paid out over $4 billion to victims of vaccine injury and death. If vaccines are so safe, why do we even need a compensation program?

The science on vaccines is not settled. There are hundreds of peer-reviewed studies showing a link between vaccines and adverse health outcomes. But the CDC and pharmaceutical industry try to suppress and discredit this research. They are more interested in profits than children's wellbeing.

At the end of the day, it's a parent's right to decide what's best for their child. But the choice is clear: vaccines are unsafe, ineffective, and unnecessary. We need to fight for our children's health and stand up against this dangerous medical intervention. The risks are just too high.
